data.title: Colin John Campbell
data.text:
MESSAGES OF CONDOLENCE / DONATIONS

Charlotte and Tom - March 27, 2023

Thinking about you lots. Will email you M. Cxxx

Michael and Marianne Hendren - February 19, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Community Living Trent Highlands

Suzanne Morrow/Barb Elsom - February 15, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Suzanne Morrow - February 15, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Debbie and Robert sommerville - February 13, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Peterborough Regional Health Centre

Karen and Mike Trenton - February 13, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Moez Bawania - February 13, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Shelly Rae - February 12, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Peterborough Regional Health Centre

Shelly & Carly Rae - February 12, 2023

We will miss Colin dearly. The description “Life of the Party” was coined for him. He brought laughter, joy and love to everyone who knew him. We have so many fond memories of Colin collected over the years and will cherish each one of them forever. Our hearts go out to you … Kennedy, Moe and Bob ❤️

Anna Millar - February 11, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Anna Millar - February 11, 2023

Please accept my deepest condolences for your loss. My thoughts are with you and your family during this difficult time.

Jeannie Baker (Aunt Pat's friend) - February 11, 2023

My heart aches for your loss of Colin. He was such a friendly vibrant guy. Although I only met him a few times over the years he left an impression. I remember when I gave him his driver's license he was so excited he made us all smile. May his memories help to heal your hearts and keep him close.❤️

Miriam Batthish - February 11, 2023

I'm deeply sorry for your loss. Please know that you and your loved ones are in my thoughts and prayers during this difficult time. May the memories of Colin bring you comfort and peace.

Sue and Dave Villeneuve - February 11, 2023

Dear Maureen ,Bob and Kennedy We are so so sorry for your loss.We know he was loved and our thoughts are with you all. Hugs Sue and Dave

Kyla Whetham - February 11, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Dylan - February 11, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Paula Sprentz - February 11, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Paula Sprentz - February 11, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Caroline Faulds - February 10, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Chloe Holmeshaw - February 10, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Barbara Allan - February 9, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Barbara Allan - February 9, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Peterborough Regional Health Centre

Terry Cully - February 8, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Adopt a Dog, Save a Life

Ryan & Kristin Ellis - February 7, 2023

Your son's legacy will live on in the hearts of all who knew and loved him. Please accept our sincere condolences.

Beth and Bruce Bellaire - February 7, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Kathleen ONeill Cowan - February 6, 2023

Maureen, Bob & Kennedy, My deepest condolences on the loss of your dear Son & Brother. I can’t even imagine the heartbreak you must be going through. May all the wonderful memories of Colin live on in your hearts forever. Sending love to you all!

Lauren Ulbricht - February 5, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Peterborough Regional Health Centre

Lauren Ulbricht - February 5, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Coleen and Dave Stewart - February 5, 2023

Maureen, Bob and Kennedy, We hope the memories that bring a smile to your face will soon overtake the deep sorrow you are feeling now. We are so sorry for your loss.

Rami Hijazi - February 5, 2023

I cannot even begin to understand what you are going through now. May the care and love of those around you provide the comfort you seek. My most heartfelt condolences.

Snezana & Milorad Cicvara - February 4, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Theresa Gray - February 3, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Marlene Charney - February 2, 2023

My deepest condolences on the loss of your beautiful son and brother. A very bright light has been dimmed. I was Colin’s drama teacher at Aurora High School a number of years ago. I remember Colin’s infectious energy and exuberance as well as his amazing work in the drama classroom. Students looked up to him and he was a role model for others. May his memory be a blessing.

Heather & Mike Hickey - February 1, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Nancy and John Zurawski - February 1, 2023

Our hearts go out to all the Campbell’s. Colin was indeed taken far to young. Please accept our sincere condolences.

Jan & Rob Barr - February 1, 2023

Taken far too soon, our thoughts are with Colin's family at this very sad time. RIP Colin. From us all here in Scotland.

Helen Bonnyman - January 31, 2023

Maureen -My sincere condolences to you and your family.

Michael Petinarelis - January 30, 2023

I had the sincerest pleasure of teaching Colin roughly 10 years ago in a grade 10 Indigenous Studies class. I remember his beaming smile, big, sociable personality and his caring, empathetic nature. He was a bright star in my classroom and a leader in our AHS community. My deepest condolences to you and your entire family for your immeasurable loss.

Don Bowen - January 29, 2023

Bob, Maureen and Kennedy. Sending our thoughts and love to you and yours through this time of extreme tragedy. We unfortunately are unable to travel back to Ontario for the memorial but please know our hearts are with you. Don and Anita

Jo Anne Nicholson - January 27, 2023

Maureen and Bob, I am so sorry to hear about the passing of your son. My heart goes out to you and your family at this difficult time. My deepest condolences.

Olive and Jim Spittel - January 26, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Lee-Anne Moore - January 26, 2023

Sharing in the act today of cherishing the memories and accomplishments of a brilliant talent! Lee-Anne Moore Visual Art Department Aurora High School YRDSB

Danielle Rasu - January 26, 2023

Deepest condolences. They say there is no greater pain- No loss that can compare... The torment when you lose a child- no human heart can bear. No one can just imagine... No one can comprehend~ Unless they lose their own child and, then ... They'll understand. You'll never really breath as strong~ Your heart will bear a scar... No words can speak the sorrow, And it changes 'who' you are. ~by Diane Ranker Rieser

Madi Nardella - January 25, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Peterborough Regional Health Centre

Madi Nardella - January 25, 2023

Colin was one of a kind. I’ve never met anyone like him. His vibrant and uplifting personality always put everyone in a good mood. There truly hasn’t been a time where I haven’t laughed when I was with him. I’m very grateful to have known him for many years, and I’ll never forget the memories we’ve shared. My deepest condolences to the Campbell family. Love you Colin.

Mark Hanson - January 24, 2023

Colin was always such a joy while working the bar at the WNCC. He always made everyone smile and laugh (and forget about the shots they missed). The world is a lesser place without him. Our deepest condolences. Mark and Michelle.

Lauri and Chris Foss - January 23, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Lauri and Chris Foss - January 23, 2023

Maureen, Bob and Kennedy, words can't express our sorrow. So sad to hear about Colin. Life is so fragile, you just never know. But you're not supposed to out live your kids. We wish you strength as you deal with the pain and loss of your brother as well as your son. We try to share your pain and want you to know you have caring friends. We look forward to seeing you all on Feb 11th, but this will be a tough one. With our deepest condolences and our love.

Victoria Foster - January 23, 2023

Some of my earliest memories are from my kindergarten class with Colin, and I am incredibly lucky to have them. My condolences to your family.

Colette van Woerkens - January 23, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Norval Wener - January 23, 2023

Hello Maureen, I am so sorry to hear about your son Colin. I hardly know what to say. It's a loss that goes to a cold dark place in all our hearts. I did not know him but it is clear from the messages being left Colin was a special person. I have not seen you for a number of years Maureen but fondly remember your smile and wonderful energy and know with time you will find a way to make peace with this terrible tragedy. I send you and your family my condolences and love. Norval

Wendy Hamilton - January 23, 2023

I'm so sorry for your incredible loss. I remember Colin as a very happy boy when he attended Devins Dr. PS with my son. My sincere condolences go out to Maureen, Bob, Kennedy & family and all his many friends. Wendy Hamilton

Candace Humphey - January 23, 2023

I am so so sorry for your lose. There are no words and as a parent, one should never have to bury their child. I am thinking of you and your family and sending you strength. Take care Maureen. Candace

Matt Wilson - January 23, 2023

I'm so sorry for your loss Maureen. I can't imagine what you and your family are going through. Please accept my condolences. Matt Wilson

John & Lori Wynsma - January 23, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

John & Lori Wynsma - January 23, 2023

We will miss Colin's wonderful wit, charm and energy. He would make us laugh from the moment he greeted us with "Hey girlfriend", and we feel grateful for time that we got to know Colin. Our deepest condolences to Bob, Maureen, and Kennedy.

Sofie Kiatipis - January 23, 2023

Colin was such a loving and happy person. We will miss him everyday. There are many many memories that I will never forget and I’m so grateful that I was able to be friends with him for many years. My condolences to the Campbell family. Love you always Colin. ❤️

Sofia Kiatipis - January 23, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Glenn Fabello - January 23, 2023

Maureen, my deepest condolences to you and the family.

Emma Cully - January 22, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Peterborough Regional Health Centre

Paul & Trish Dunbar - January 22, 2023

So sorry to hear of such a tragic young loss. Our thoughts are with the whole Campbell family both close and extended at this most tough of times Paul & Trish

Nikki Anjavi - January 22, 2023

Knowing Colin was a gift that I will forever cherish close to my heart. His contagious energy was one of his most special qualities. I feel incredibly grateful to have been part of his life and to have shared years of memorable experiences and laughter. No one has ever made me laugh in the ways he did, and I’ll miss those moments more than ever. Sending all those who have been blessed with his presence thoughts and prayers during this difficult time. I love you forever and ever Colin❤️

Nikki Anjavi - January 22, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Sara Rumble - January 22, 2023

Being friends with Colin was truly an honour. He touched everyone’s life in one way or another. His energy, laughter and smile were extremely contagious. He is truly one of a kind and had more charisma than anyone I have ever met. He could make me laugh until I cried. I’m so grateful to have known him and have so many memories with him that I will cherish forever. My dearest condolences to Colin’s family. We love you forever coco ❤️

Taryn MacDonald - January 21, 2023

The passing of my dear friend Colin is such a heartbreaking loss. A life gone too soon. But reading these stories posted solidifies the fact that it was a life well- lived. Whether you met Colin once or knew him for a lifetime, he was the type of person that made on impact on everyone he met. I was lucky to have grown up with him and attend Dalhousie with him- I’ll forever hold those memories close to my heart. I love you Coco and I’ll miss you forever. Sending my deepest condolences and love to the Campbell family in this difficult time.

Cameron Scott - January 21, 2023

Colin was my best friend in the world and there are no words to describe how hard his passing is. Sending all of my love to Maureen, Bob and Kennedy. Colin was such a bright light and so kind and funny to everyone he met. He truly made every single person in my family laugh. We all cared for him so much and we will miss his goofy and mischievous ways. He was so loved and will be so deeply missed. Love to the Campbell family from the Scott family; Cameron, Anne, Alan and Lilly.

Avery Worrall - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Avery Worrall - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Cameron Scott - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Leo D'Aguiar - January 21, 2023

I met Colin in Grade 10. At the time I had a lot of health issues. I wasn't at school much and when I was, I wasn't the happiest person out there. But from the day we met, Colin tried his absolute hardest to reach out to me. At the end of that year, my family pulled me out of school. I didn't see him, or most people really, until I came back for prom. I was pretty nervous about seeing everyone again and... well, at first, it didn't go so well. I was about to leave and forget the whole thing. That's when Colin walked in. He was so happy to see me. He told me he saw my name on the guest list and specifically asked if I could be seated next to him, just so I felt welcomed. He anticipated how awkward a situation that would be, and went out of his way to help me... it blew me away. It was such an act of kindness. The fact that he could touch the heart of a person who was trying to keep everyone at arm's length is a testament to how special he was. I am so glad that someone like him was so loved. And I'm so sorry that someone who shined so brightly is gone so soon. My love and condolences go out to his family and friends.

Emily Chouinard - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Emily Chouinard - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Lorri Schuetz - January 21, 2023

Please accept my sincere condolences 💐. I was saddened to hear of the passing of my cute, funny Colin from my Kindergarten class. Please know that I will be praying for all of you during this difficult time. Sincerely, Ms. Schuetz

Lori and Wayne Brander - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Emma Hough - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Taryn MacDonald - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Charlotte Cully - January 21, 2023

Thank you Maureen and Bob for bringing such a unique, incredibly kind, and hilarious human into this world. From the day we met in Grade 9 at AHS Colin became one of my best and most cherished friends. So many of my favourite memories in highschool and beyond involved Colin. He had the best sense of humour. He wore his heart on his sleeve. I’m so grateful for the countless conversations, dances, and belly laughs shared. Colin was a connector and brought so many people together. I’ll never forget the times just hanging out in your basement, to driving around town blasting music with new licenses, to prom, to concerts, times at the cottage, I could go on. Sending love, strength and light to your family. I love you so much Coco - Char

Brittany Visconti - January 21, 2023

There aren’t enough words to express how much I miss Colin. He was one of the greatest friends I’ve ever had. Sending my love and condolences to Bob, Maureen and Kennedy.

Brittany Visconti - January 21, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Linda Fine - January 21, 2023

Maureen and family, My heartfelt condolences on the loss of Colin. Words cannot express my sadness. May his memory always be a blessing to you and your family. Linda Fine

Dan and Sue Dolan - January 21, 2023

We are fairly recent members of the West Northumberland curling club. We had the wonderful opportunity and pleasure of meeting Colin last year (2021/2022) at the club where he was our favorite bar tender! We looked forward to seeing him weekly where he always served up drinks with a huge smile and good humor! He even used to go out of his way to make Sue's hot chocolate and deliver it personally to her table! We got to know him on a bit of a personal level and thought very highly of him. His gentle manner and kind soul shone through. We were devastated to hear the news of his passing and send you our deepest condolences.

Bob & Nettie McHugh - January 21, 2023

Dear Maureen and Family, Very sorry to hear of Colin’s passing. Our sincere condolences go out to you at this sad time. May the Good Lord bless you with peace, solace, comfort, and hope. Blessings, Bob & Nettie McHugh

Brittany Smith - January 21, 2023

Colin truly was one of a kind. Knowing him and being friends with him was a gift and I feel so beyond lucky to have had the opportunity to have known him. His presence, his laugh and his smile lit up a room. He was the funniest person I’ve ever met. I’ll never forget his laugh. To the Campbell family, I am so incredibly sorry for your loss. I’m thinking of all of you and sending you so much love. We love you forever coco.

Joanne & Kevin Thompson - January 21, 2023

We wish to express our sincere condolences Maureen, Bob, and Kennedy on the loss of your beloved son and brother. Our Aurora home backed onto your home for many years and we’d often chat at the back fence line. We have fond memories of all the kids playing in the yards. Thinking of you at this very sad time.

Sam and Andrew Fuller - January 21, 2023

Our hearts are broken for your loss. Although we have never met Colin, he sounded like the kind of person who filled a room with joy and happiness. We are sending our love and prayers during this heartbreaking time.

Linda and Dave Potter - January 21, 2023

So very sad for your loss, Bob, Maureen and family. 💜

Lee & Vanessa Glenister - January 21, 2023

So sorry to hear of your loss Bob , our thoughts and prayers are with you and your family .

Erin Cartwright - January 21, 2023

To all of Colin’s family and dear friends, my heart breaks for you all, this sudden passing of such a beautiful bright light is so very heartbreaking to hear. I had the pleasure of sharing the stage with Colin back in my WaveStage Theatre days and not one moment went by that he didn’t put a smile on our faces. He truly did light up a room with his warmth, awesome sense of humour and his genuine kindness. My deepest condolences, I send strength and love to you all during this very difficult time.

Lynn Hutchison - January 20, 2023

I am so sorry for your loss. I so remember Colin as a little boy and his friendship with Connor at Montessori. Such a special person. My heartbreaks for your loss Maureen , Bob and Kennedy. 😢💔

Judi Ross - January 20, 2023

My sincere condolences on the loss of your beloved son. May your memories comfort you at this most difficult time.

Rebecca Kolarich - January 20, 2023

I have never met anyone like Colin. He had such a huge personality and was the kind of person that could make you belly-laugh on cue. He was such a bright light, so lovable and so so caring. I’m so grateful for his friendship. Sending my love to the Campbell family.

Rebecca Kolarich - January 20, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Schuyler Gleeson - January 20, 2023

I met Colin after he switched schools and came to Devins Drive in grade 4. It was never a dull moment when Colin was around. He lit up a room when he walked in, you couldn’t help but join in laughing when he started to laugh and he was just the kindest soul. My condolences go out to the entire Campbell family and all of those who had the pleasure of knowing Colin.

Olivia Delbello - January 20, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Olivia Delbello - January 20, 2023

There will never be another Colin, the brightest light in every room. I am thinking of you all constantly, sending infinite amounts of love and hugs. My sincere condolences.

Carol Becker - January 20, 2023

Maureen, my heart goes out to you and your family. Sometimes there just are no words. My sincere condolences.

Rachel Sanderson - January 20, 2023

Anyone who got the privilege of knowing Colin in this life was lucky. He was so special and one of a kind. My condolences to Kenn, Mo and Bob. Such a special soul that will live on in all of our hearts forever.

Louise Hanson - January 20, 2023

I am incredibly sad for your loss and really have no words to express my sincerest condolences. I am sending love with the hope that you and your family will be surrounded and supported by many through this impossibly difficult loss. Love Louise

Laura - January 20, 2023

I am so sorry. When I met Colin, he never failed to make everyone around him laugh and smile. I will miss him.

Buckley Family - January 20, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

David & Donna Buckley - January 20, 2023

Bob, Mo & Kennedy, So incredibly sad to hear this. Cannot begin to understand what you are going through. All our prayers and thoughts with you.

Sierra Nardella - January 20, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Sierra Nardella - January 20, 2023

Colin was one of my dearest friends and one of the most special people I've ever known in my life. He was always the brightest light in the room and cared so deeply about all of his friends, which he had many of. We were all so lucky to have experienced a life that included Colin and we'll never forget him. My sincere condolences to Maureen, Bob, and Kennedy. You are constantly in my thoughts and prayers.

Kathy May - January 20, 2023

Maureen, Bob and Kennedy, I am so sorry for your loss. I hope your cherished memories will be a comfort to you, and to all who knew and loved Colin. With deepest sympathy from cousin Kathy and all the Jones family.

Gren MacDonald - January 20, 2023

Maureen, I am so sorry for the loss of your son. My heart and prayers go out to you and your family. Gren

Cj - January 20, 2023

Maureen, my heart goes out to you and your family. Sometimes there just are no words. If you need anything at all, please let me know. Take care, cj

Linda and David Laliberte - January 20, 2023

We were so sorry to hear about Colin. He was a great addition to the 5:30 curling experience, very friendly, always a smile on his face and always went the extra mile. Our thoughts are with you during this difficult time.

Ambrose Family - January 20, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Martin & Paula Ambrose - January 20, 2023

Please accept our deepest and sincerest condolences at your loss. Our thoughts and prayers are with your family at this difficult time. Sincerely, Martin and Paula Ambrose

Christina Di Manno - January 20, 2023

Maureen and family, please accept my deepest condolences to you. Thoughts and prayers are with you through this difficult time.

Mary Lou Secord/Lynn Marie Johnston - January 20, 2023

We enjoyed Colin. He was a great character. Full of charm and he was witty. Gone way too early. We are so sorry for your loss Maureen , Bob and Kennedy.

Sandra Worden - January 20, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Peterborough Regional Health Centre

Erin Caines - January 19, 2023

“ Don't wish. Don't Start. Wishing only wounds the heart” “....Everyone deserves a chance to fly!” Wicked is finally at rest. My heart goes out to the family of his beautiful bright soul. He will be missed more then words will allow

Karen Atkinson - January 19, 2023

I am so sorry Bob and Maureen for your loss. I can’t imagine what you are going through. You are in my thoughts and prayers.

Evelina MacEachern - January 19, 2023

Maureen, Bob and Kennedy I am so sorry to hear of the loss of your beloved son and brother. My heart goes out to you and your family. May your memories bring you comfort during this difficult time and in the days ahead. Big hugs, xx

Carole Parriey - January 19, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Carole and Karen - January 19, 2023

Our sincere condolences to you and your family for the loss of your beloved son.

Beth CARTER - January 19, 2023

I won’t be able to attend the celebration for Colin as I am out of the Province but I will be thinking of all of you and remembering a life that ended too soon. My deepest sympathies.

Laura Garton & Frank Burns - January 19, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Laura Garton - January 19, 2023

I'm sorry I didn't have the opportunity to get to know Colin but I know he was a very special and much loved son with great hopes and dreams. I am so sorry. It is truly an enormous loss. You have my deepest sympathy. Laura

Arek - January 19, 2023

Maureen, Bob, please accept my deepest condolences to you and your family.

Jannette Sam - January 19, 2023

Please accept my sincere condolences for your loss. My thoughts are with you and your family.

Jannette Sam - January 19, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Northumberland Hills Hospital Foundation

Chris Gory - January 18, 2023 DONATION

A Memorial Donation has been made to the following charity:

Rick Hansen, Man in Motion Foundation

Irv & Lorie Murphy - January 18, 2023

Although we did not know Colin we want to express our deepest condolences. Cannot imagine what you are going through at this time, but we are here you need to talk.

Jeff and Laurie Pudwell - January 18, 2023

In the short time we got to know Colin at the curling rink, his quick wit and sense of humour were quite apparent. So sorry for your loss. Our thoughts and prayers are with you all.

Lorraine mcinnes - January 18, 2023

I’m so sorry for your loss of Colin. While I can’t empathize completely with a loss of a child I empathize deeply with the pain you all feel. If ever I can be an ear to listen I promise you I will. I will support you in any way I can. Much love. Lorraine

Samantha Buckley - January 18, 2023

To the whole Campbell family, my deepest deepest condolences to you all. We were absolutely heartbroken to hear of Colin’s passing. He was truly a shining light in this world. I’m positive his light will continue to shine down on us all. I will always treasure the laughs & moments we shared together. I hope you find peace in knowing how loved he was. Sending you loads of love and strength during this period. <3

Steve J - January 18, 2023

My condolences to the family! Colin was always so fun, happy, joking!

JoAnn Kropf-Hedley - January 18, 2023

I didn’t know Colin but after reading about him I can see he was an amazing young man! Your family has my sorrows .
